subsection_content:
Chlamydia can be treated with antibiotics. However, do not stop taking the medicine after your symptoms improve. Instead, see a specialist for examination and treatment to avoid relapse.
In addition, during treatment, patients need to note the following:
Do not have sex during the treatment period; Contact and notify your partner that you are infected. Because, they also need to be examined and treated for Chlamydia promptly.; Testing for other sexually transmitted diseases: HIV/AIDS, syphilis, gonorrhea,...; In some cases, reinfection is possible, so about 3 months after treatment, the patient should see a doctor to check their health status.
Do tests to detect Chlamydia.
